alert.note: Alert for Adams; Clay; Nuckolls; Webster (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 11:17PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHERN JEWELL...NORTHEASTERN SMITH...CLAY...WESTERN NUCKOLLS...WEBSTER...ADAMS...SOUTHWESTERN HAMILTON AND SOUTHERN HALL COUNTIES THROUGH MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1116 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hastings to near Red Cloud. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Hastings, Red Cloud, Blue Hill, Ayr, and Cowles around 1120 PM CDT. Trumbull and Rosemont around 1125 PM CDT. Glenvil and Inland around 1130 PM CDT. Lawrence and Guide Rock around 1135 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Harvard, Fairfield, Deweese and Clay Center. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for north central Kansas...and south central Nebraska.
